metadata.Title: CVE-2014-3707 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The curl_easy_duphandle function in libcurl 7.17.1 through 7.38.0, when running with the CURLOPT_COPYPOSTFIELDS option, does not properly copy HTTP POST data for an easy handle, which triggers an out-of-bounds read that allows remote web servers to read sensitive memory information.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-3707` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

curl - 7.35.0-1ubuntu2.2
libcurl3 - 7.35.0-1ubuntu2.2
libcurl3-gnutls - 7.35.0-1ubuntu2.2
libcurl3-nss - 7.35.0-1ubuntu2.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: curl package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7.35.0-1ubuntu2.2').
